imageprocessing

Class ImageSelection

  • java.lang.Object
    • imageprocessing.ImageSelection

  • public abstract class ImageSelection
extends java.lang.Object
    ImageSelection tools This class defines all static methods which calculate things concerning the image selection.
    Author:
    Till

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ImageSelection() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static double[][] adaptCoordinates(double[][] koordinaten)
      Method to adapt the coordinates, most top-left coordinate will be (1,1) i.e. subtract the smallest occuring coordinate from all coordinates.
      static int[] selectInside(View view, java.awt.Shape shp)
      Method to select all pixels inside the shapes.

      Method to select all pixels outside the shape.

        public ImageSelection()

    • Method Detail

      • selectInside

        public static int[] selectInside(View view,
                 java.awt.Shape shp)
        Method to select all pixels inside the shapes. Used to create a new View from the selected areas.
        Parameters:
        view - The view whose examples should be selected.
        shp - The list of shapes to define the areas to be selected.
        Returns:
        The indices of the view's examples which are inside the shapes.

      • selectOutside

        public static int[] selectOutside(View view,
                  java.awt.Shape shp)
        Method to select all pixels outside the shape. Used to create a new View from the unselected area (selected area removed).
        Parameters:
        view - The view whose examples should be selected.
        shp - The shape to define the area to be removed.
        Returns:
        The indices of the view's examples which are outside the shape.

      • selectRectangle

        public static java.awt.Rectangle selectRectangle(int width,
                                 int height,
                                 double scale,
                                 java.awt.Point p,
                                 java.awt.Point firstPoint)
        This method controls the selection of a rectangle. Rectangle is selected by pressing and then dragging mouse. For example: - Different calculation, when the rectangle is dragged to the bottom-right/bottom-left/top-right/top-left direction - Different handling of the selected rectangle, if the cursor exites the image display/is outside the image
        Parameters:
        width - Width of the picture display.
        height - Heigth of the picture display.
        scale - Current zooming scale.
        p - Current point/position of the cursor while dragging
        firstPoint - Position of the cursor when mouse has been pressed.
        Returns:

      • adaptCoordinates

        public static double[][] adaptCoordinates(double[][] koordinaten)
        Method to adapt the coordinates, most top-left coordinate will be (1,1) i.e. subtract the smallest occuring coordinate from all coordinates.
        Parameters:
        koordinaten - former Coordinates
        Returns:
        adapted coordinates: double[][] with 2 columns
